Name: Statue of Harpocrates as a Young Boy
Description: The wonderful marble statue depicts Harpocrates as a nude young boy with his thumb in his mouth.Traces of red color are found on the head, the eyes, the hair, and the arms. He rests his left arm on a column with decorations imitating alabaster. A cloak, is gathered on his arm and covers a part of the column. In Alexandria during the Ptolemaic era, Harpocrates was a new image of the Egyptian god Horus, portrayed in different forms, sometimes as an infant or as a young boy.
